file_content.text: May the Force be with you.
I knew you wouldn't fail. You have the strength of the young. Now let's have a look at what you found.... Hmm....
This appears to be a targeting device. Part of a larger weapon. Thank the stars you kept this away from the Sith.
From what I'm hearing on the comm channels, you're needed elsewhere. Go--may the Force be with you.
Stop the Sith looting the vault first, then disable their starship. Once that's done, return with any technology you find.
I knew if I was patient, the Force would send help--but your team is more than I hoped for.
The hero of Tython? The Force must surely have guided you here--and not a moment too soon.
Thank the Force you're here, young one. I'm getting too old to face these situations alone.
You aren't Jedi--but if you've made it this far, the Force is clearly with you. I need your help.
I came to Belsavis to aid the Republic, but I fear my strengths lie in the Jedi Archives, not on the battlefield.
The Sith are stealing destructive ancient devices from the alien vaults. You must stop those fools from leaving the planet with them.
The Emperor seeks to destroy this world. Can your mission wait?
I'm busy saving Belsavis.
If the Sith escape with these devices, they could become too powerful for us to defeat. We can't allow that.
I wasn't aware Belsavis stored anything besides criminals.
Ancient technology? Here?
Many things were left on this world in the belief they'd be secured forever. Such was the hubris of the prison's builders.
I've handled containment scenarios like this before. Give me the mission briefing.
Havoc Squad is on it.
Do these devices have a credit value attached? Just curious.
I smell opportunity.
These ancient devices could lay waste to planets. They are not to be bought or sold.
Me? But you're a Jedi Master.
A Jedi must admit his limits. I'm not a young man. You're young and strong--you'll succeed where I can't.
Sounds like my kind of fun.
Teams of Sith are looting a nearby vault. You'll need to drive them back and recover any devices they've taken. But that's not all....
You also need to disable the enemy's starship so it cannot leave Belsavis. This charge will destroy the vessel's engines.
Don't worry.
My objectives are clear.
If the Sith vessel tries to leave, the turret here is our last hope. I'll fire it if I must, though artillery isn't exactly my specialty.
Besides, the last thing we want is ancient, deadly technology scattered across this valley.
Bring anything you find to me. We need to know what our enemy has toyed with. May the Force be with you....
I'm too busy. [Refuse quest]
These are not merely machines--they're weapons. In Sith hands, they'll create horrific suffering.
Perhaps this turret can destroy the Sith vessel when it tries to leave--though my aim isn't what it used to be....
Belsavis needs all the defenders we can muster. May the Force be with you.
Yes, Master.
